body:
BTW: I have really problems to understand AvtiveRecord/Arel
e.g there is :quote in ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::Quoting with the comment
'''
      # Quotes the column value to help prevent
      # {SQL injection attacks}[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SQL_injection].
'''
but there is also an ActiveRecord::Sanitization module with :quote_value and :sanitize  ?!?!

And in ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::Quoting  the code of :quote seems almost be duplicated in :type_cast

IMHO "quoting" is the process of converting the internal value in a format that the database understands. 
So :quote should call
*  :quoted_date for DateTime values, 
*  :quoted_true and :quoted_false for boolean values
        ( which decides depending on the column type if it will present it as 0/1 or t/f or TRUE/FALSE )
*  :quoted_string for String values ( which calls :sanitize_string to prevent sql_injection )
    ( and quotes the String with N'...' if it is a Unicode column )
* etc...

I would like to rewrite ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::Quoting top have a clearer code, but I fear that will break all ConnectionAdapters :-((
